roleset.name: to assume, take for granted
roleset.note: PRESUME-V NOTES: Frames file for 'presume' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from presume.01-v)

example.name: presume-v: transitive
example.text: As it stands now , Congress presumes after the Reagan administration that the White House will take unconstitutionalprovisions in appropriations bills [*-1]lying down .
example.arg: the White House will take unconstitutional provisions in appropriations bills [*-1]lying down

example.name: presume-v: raising
example.text: Company officials said [0] 22 workers were missing and presumed dead .

example.name: presumptive-j: concatenated thing assumed
example.text: McCain is the presumptive nominee for the Republicans.

example.name: presumption-n: All args
example.text: Sgt. Crowley's report of the incident reflects his presumption that a criminal act was taking place.
example.arg: that a criminal act was taking place

roleset.name: Excessively forward
roleset.note: PRESUMPTUOUS NOTES: Adjectival 'presumptuous' based on BOLT-6. (from presume.01-v)

roles.note: arg0 may be realized as a presumptuous action (potentially with subject of action extracted, requiring concatenation) withbadjectival rel 'presumptuous'. (from presume.01-v)

example.name: presumptuous-j
example.text: Of course it is a little farfetched and presumptuous to say so , and also to praises the thief .

example.name: presumptuous-j: Concatenated arg0
example.text: He was presumptuous to assume they had become friends.
